thread.title: Clinton hits Sanders: 'I am not in favor of making college free for Donald Trump's kids'
thread.title_full: Clinton hits Sanders: 'I am not in favor of making college free for Donald Trump's kids' | Washington Examiner

author: Ariel Cohen
title: Clinton hits Sanders: 'I am not in favor of making college free for Donald Trump's kids'
text:
As her once insurmountable lead over the Democratic field begins to slip, Hillary Clinton hit Bernie Sanders for the first time Monday on NBC's "Today."
"I am not in favor of making college free for Donald Trump's kids," Clinton said of Sanders' plan for free college. Many Democrats support Sanders' education plan for universal free public higher education, whereas Clinton's plan just calls for debt-free higher education, but still requires students to pay for their school.
On the campaign trail, Clinton has tried to avoid mentioning the other Democrats running by name, but as the first party's first debate looms, she couldn't avoid taking the shot.
At first Clinton said, "Let me talk about myself and I'll let Sen. Sanders talk about himself." But she did end up saying she could solve income inequality better than Sanders, citing her experience. "I know what to do because I have watched it up close and personal," she said.
  U.S., Pacific Rim countries announce TPP trade deal Trade negotiators reached the historic deal in Atlanta between the U.S., Japan and 10 Pacific Rim nations.
By Kelly Cohen • 10/05/15 9:32 AM Sanders leads Clinton in New Hampshire and has been gaining in some other polls while attracting large crowds on the stump. The first Democratic presidential debate is next Tuesday.
Clinton contended that she was happy he was in the race and she "really believe[s] this is great for the Democratic Party and for this election." Asked if she would consider the vice presidential slot on the Democratic ticket, she laughed, "Hypothetically speaking, no!"
Top Story Can Clinton delete her past? Clinton's campaign is in a   ones.
By Sarah Westwood • 10/05/15 12:01 AM
